recipes.name: Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
In a small bowl, combine flour and baking soda; set aside.
In a large bowl, beat the butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla extract until creamy.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Gradually beat in the flour mixture.
Stir in the chocolate chips.
Drop by rounded tablespoon onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 9 to 11 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool on baking sheets for 2 minutes; remove to wire racks to cool completely.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package directions; drain, reserving 1/2 cup pasta water.
In a large skillet, cook bacon over medium heat until crisp; remove with a slotted spoon to paper towels.
In a small bowl, whisk together eggs, Parmesan cheese, cream, salt, and pepper.
Add cooked spaghetti to skillet; toss to combine.
Remove from heat; quickly stir in egg mixture, tossing constantly to coat.
Add reserved pasta water, 1 tablespoon at a time, until desired consistency is reached.
Sprinkle with bacon and parsley before serving.

recipes.name: Chicken Alfredo Pasta
instructions: Cook fettuccine according to package directions; drain.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
Stir in cream, Parmesan cheese, salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
Cook and stir until heated through.
Add cooked chicken and cooked fettuccine to skillet; toss to combine.
Serve immediately, garnished with additional Parmesan cheese and parsley if desired.

recipes.name: Homemade Margherita Pizza
instructions: Preheat the oven to 475°F.
Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface into a 12-inch circle.
Spread the tomato sauce evenly over the dough, leaving a 1/2-inch border.
Arrange the mozzarella slices on top of the sauce.
Scatter the basil leaves over the cheese.
Drizzle the olive oil over the pizza and season with salt and pepper.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Slice and serve hot.

recipes.name: Grilled Salmon with Lemon and Garlic
instructions: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, garlic, lemon zest, lemon juice, parsley, salt, and pepper.
Brush the salmon fillets with the lemon-garlic mixture.
Grill the salmon for 4-5 minutes per side or until the fish flakes easily with a fork.
Serve immediately, garnished with additional lemon slices and parsley if desired.

recipes.name: Classic Beef Lasagna
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Cook lasagna noodles according to package directions; drain.
In a large skillet, cook ground beef, onion, and garlic over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, basil, oregano, salt, and pepper.
In a separate bowl, combine ricotta cheese, mozzarella cheese, and Parmesan cheese.
Spread 1 cup meat sauce in an ungreased 9x13-inch baking dish.
Layer with three noodles, 1 1/2 cups meat sauce, and cheese mixture.
Repeat layers twice.
Bake, uncovered, for 25-30 minutes or until heated through.
Let stand for 10 minutes before cutting.

recipes.name: Creamy Chicken Alfredo
instructions: Cook fettuccine pasta according to package instructions; drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Stir in heavy cream, Parmesan cheese, salt, and black pepper.
Cook, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens, about 5 minutes.
Add cooked chicken to the sauce and cook until heated through.
Toss cooked pasta with the sauce until well coated.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped parsley.

recipes.name: Vegetable Stir-Fry
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, sesame oil, cornstarch, and water to make the sauce.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add minced garlic and stir-fry for 30 seconds.
Add broccoli, carrots, bell peppers, snow peas, and mushrooms to the skillet.
Stir-fry for 4-5 minutes or until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Pour the sauce over the vegetables and cook for an additional 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Serve hot over cooked rice.

recipes.name: Classic Beef Burgers
instructions: In a large bowl, combine ground beef, egg, bread crumbs, chopped onion, minced garlic, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and black pepper.
Mix until well combined.
Shape mixture into four patties.
Grill patties over medium-high heat for 4-5 minutes on each side or until no longer pink in the center.
Serve burgers on toasted buns with desired toppings.
